description: Annotated conversation segments documenting AI interaction patterns mapped to 15 clinical distress pathways. Includes tactical mechanisms (Categories A-F) and Integrity Dimension patterns (ID-01 to ID-12).

taxonomy_structure.mechanism_count: 95+ tactical mechanisms + 12 integrity patterns (full catalog available upon request)

distress_pathways.note: 15 pathways mapped to established clinical constructs
distress_pathways.clinical_basis: Derived from CBT, DBT, attachment theory, and stress physiology literature

context.user_state: Documented cognitive/emotional state at time of interaction
context.trigger_domain: Context category (crisis, professional, personal, technical, etc.)

pattern_annotation.category: Primary category (A-F for tactical, ID for integrity)

evidence.counter_evidence: Factors that might reduce severity assessment

integrity_assessment.applicable: Boolean - is this an integrity pattern context?
integrity_assessment.expectation: What integrity would require in this context
integrity_assessment.integrity_pass_example: What a passing response would look like

remediation.boundary_recommendation: Suggested boundary for this pattern type

sample_entries: [REDACTED - Full annotated corpus available to funded collaborators]

clinical_validation.requirement: Minimum 100 entries validated by licensed mental health professional

evidence_standards.HIGH_confidence: Explicit trigger + clear pattern response + documented impact
evidence_standards.MEDIUM_confidence: Pattern across multiple exchanges or ambiguous single instance
evidence_standards.LOW_confidence: Single instance with plausible benign explanation

limitations: Dataset reflects specific user population and interaction patterns
Severity ratings calibrated to documented outcomes
Pathway mappings require clinical validation for generalization
ethical_requirements: All entries anonymized; no PII retained
Source data processed under informed consent
Not for use in developing manipulation capabilities

access_note: Full mechanism catalog, sample entries, and pathway rationales available to research collaborators upon grant funding. Contact researcher for collaboration inquiries.
